newsitem.title: DENMARK: Copenhagen Bourse poised to extend trading hours.
newsitem.headline: Copenhagen Bourse poised to extend trading hours.

text.p: Copenhagen Stock Exchange said on Tuesday it expected to extend daily trading hours until 1500 gmt starting in the autumn.
"We are working on extending our opening hours from September 8," Copenhagen Stock Exchange managing director Lars Johansen told Reuters.
The Copenhagen Stock Exchange, which trades stocks and bonds, is currently open for trading from 0700 gmt until 1330 gmt from Monday to Friday.
Johansen said that the planned extension was primarily to enable the Danish bourse to be open longer into U.S. trading hours.
Stockholm Stock Exchange last year extended its daily opening hours until 1500 gmt and Oslo did likewise last March.
Johansen told Reuters earlier that he expected longer trading hours to boost overall bourse turnover.
The plan coincides with negotiations on closer cooperation with Stockholm Stock Exchange.

"We are currently in talks with Stockholm bourse on setting up a joint information and trading system and we hope to have negotiated a deal before the summer holidays," Johansen said. --Ole Mikkelsen, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969654
